intro: Pavetta owariensis var. satabiei, commonly known as the Satabie pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, black seeds.
